CatDescriptText: Mr. Silas Wilde, 2021 Centre Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 15, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think common-law marriage should be outlawed?" answer reads: "I think that it should be outlawed. A lot of people get together and have kids who go through life nameless, that is, without the true name of their father, and in some cases they don't know who their father is.  All this results from common law marriages."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Silas Wilde, wearing light colored flecked coat over shoulders, dark double breasted suit jacket, light colored shirt with horizontal pinstripes, and hat with dark band, standing in front of brick archway with metal fence and sign inscribed " bake sale...", buildings and sign for Tom Tucker soda in background
